Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How has your week been?
Hey! It’s been pretty good, actually. I tried going to a game night, just like we talked about.
That’s fantastic! How did it go?
It was a lot of fun! I met some really cool people, and we played a bunch of games together.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did it feel to connect with new people in that setting?
Honestly, it felt so refreshing. I was nervous at first, but once we started playing, it felt natural.
That’s a significant step forward! Did you get a chance to share any personal experiences with them?
I did! I talked about moving to L.A. and how I’m getting used to everything. They seemed interested.
That’s great! Sharing your story can help build those connections. Did you feel comfortable opening up?
Yeah, surprisingly. It felt good to talk about it.
That’s excellent progress! Have you been able to keep in touch with any of them since then?
A couple of them have added me on social media, so we’ve been chatting a bit.
That’s a fantastic way to maintain those connections. It sounds like you’re building a supportive network. How does that make you feel?
It makes me feel less isolated. I’m really happy about it.
That’s wonderful to hear! What other steps do you think you could take to continue nurturing these connections?
Maybe I could organize another game night or something.
That’s a great idea! Taking the initiative can help solidify those friendships. Have you thought about how you might invite them again?
I could create a group chat or something. It would be easier to coordinate.
Absolutely! A group chat can help everyone stay in the loop and make planning easier. How do you feel about reaching out to them?
A bit anxious again, but I think I can manage it.
That’s completely normal. Remember, you’ve already taken a big step by connecting with them. You can do this!
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your encouragement.
Of course! Now, let’s shift gears a bit. Last time, we discussed your family and how you were missing them. Have you had a chance to connect with them since then?
Yes, I called my parents last weekend. It was really nice to hear their voices.
That’s wonderful! How did that conversation go?
It was good. We talked about everything, and I felt a bit more grounded afterward.
I’m glad to hear that! Keeping those connections strong can really help with feelings of homesickness. Do you have plans to call them again soon?
Yeah, I’m thinking about making it a regular thing, like every Sunday.
That sounds like a solid plan. It gives you something to look forward to each week. How do you think that will impact your feelings about being away?
I think it’ll help a lot. Just knowing I can talk to them whenever I want makes it easier.
That’s a healthy perspective. It’s important to find ways to feel connected, even from a distance. Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I’ve been thinking about my job search. I feel a bit stuck.
That’s understandable. Job searching can be challenging, especially in a new city. What specific challenges are you facing?
I guess I’m not sure where to start. There are so many opportunities, but I don’t know which ones to pursue.
It can be overwhelming. Have you thought about narrowing down your focus based on your interests or skills?
Yeah, I’ve considered that. I think I need to refine my portfolio too.
That’s a great idea! Focusing on your strengths can help you stand out. Would you like to set a goal for your job search for our next session?
Sure! I could work on updating my portfolio and applying to a few jobs.
That sounds like a solid plan. How many jobs would you like to aim for applying to by next week?
Maybe three or four? That feels manageable.
That’s a realistic goal! Remember to celebrate those small victories along the way. How do you feel about this plan?
I feel good about it. It gives me something to work toward.
Excellent! I’m looking forward to hearing about your progress next time. Is there anything else on your mind before we wrap up?
No, I think I’m all set. Thanks for the support!
You’re doing great! I’m here to help, and I’m excited to see how things go for you. Take care, and I’ll see you next week!
Bye!
